p: Supercritical spray drying refers to the spraying of an aqueous solution into an excess of supercritical CO 2. Similar to hot air spray-drying, supercritical CO 2 spray drying utilizes the increased solubility of CO 2 with water at supercritical conditions. The break-up of the aqueous solution into very tiny droplets (with high surface area to volume ratios) enhances the mass transfer of water into the supercritical CO 2 in the drying chamber and therefore, the water is removed continually from the drying chamber.
